授業目的: These are introductory lectures to the basics of accounting. The objective of this course is to familiarize students with accounting and financial reporting concepts so they may understand their application and meaning in business.
到達目標: While undertaking this course, students will learn common frameworks for conducting accounting activities, become familiar with the structure of financial statements and practice making appropriate adjustments in order to reconcile basic business entries and activities. Specifically, students will... 1. Define accounting and bookkeeping. 2. Explore common accounting rules and practices in business 3. Apply accounting rules to adjust financial information 4. Prepare financial statements 5. Utilize the course content to successfully record practical entries for a business
授業方法: Online Format: Simultaneous and Two-way. The course will be conducted in English. Classwork will involve discussions and bookkeeping practice. Download and install the ZOOM application from ZOOM.com and use the following link to join the lecture at the normally scheduled time. Meeting ID: 845 4802 3020

第2回: Balance Sheets and Income Statements
第5回: Expense Measurements and Income Statements
第6回: Inventories and the Cost of Sales
トピック.授業外学習2: While any courses in accounting, finance or management will be of great benefit to students, the course is designed and conducted for beginners with no familiarity with accounting.
